original_content:
What is in store for the New Year?



More of the same-that's what life seems like to many of us.

Though some may have new experiences and excitement this

new year-life for many of us will be one day strung behind the

other with the same tasks hovering before our eyes and the same

troubles settling on our shoulders. It doesn't make much difference

what number we write for the year.



Thank God one thing never changes. Would we want a Lord who 

changes His mind and issues a recall for promises He made yesterday?

A Lord who forgets His full payment for all our sins and now demands 

that we cover sin's debt? A Lord who closes the door to heaven He 

once opened with His resurrection? More of the same! YES that's 

what we need and that's what we have in the Savior Jesus Christ, who 

"Is the same yesterday and today and forever." Heb. 13:8



Pastor Al and Marcie Sather

Let us be transformed by the renewing of our mind. Ro. 12:2



My prayer is that you will have a Happy and Safe New Year.
original_reflection_text: What is in store for the New Year? More of the same-that's what life seems like to many of us. Though some may have new experiences and excitement this new year-life for many of us will be one day strung behind the other with the same tasks hovering before our eyes and the same troubles settling on our shoulders. It doesn't make much difference what number we write for the year. Thank God one thing never changes. Would we want a Lord who changes His mind and issues a recall for promises He made yesterday? A Lord who forgets His full payment for all our sins and now demands that we cover sin's debt? A Lord who closes the door to heaven He once opened with His resurrection? More of the same! YES that's what we need and that's what we have in the Savior Jesus Christ, who "Is the same yesterday and today and forever." Hebrews 13:8
original_verse_text: "Is the same yesterday and today and forever."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that You are the same yesterday, today, and forever. Your promises never change, and Your love for us is steadfast. As we enter this new year, help us to find comfort and security in the unchanging nature of Your character. May we trust in Your unwavering faithfulness, knowing that You are a God who keeps His word and provides for our every need. In the name of Jesus, our unchanging Savior, we pray. Amen.
reflection: What is in store for the New Year? More of the same-that's what life seems like to many of us. Though some may have new experiences and excitement this new year-life for many of us will be one day strung behind the other with the same tasks hovering before our eyes and the same troubles settling on our shoulders. It doesn't make much difference what number we write for the year. Thank God one thing never changes. Would we want a Lord who changes His mind and issues a recall for promises He made yesterday? A Lord who forgets His full payment for all our sins and now demands that we cover sin's debt? A Lord who closes the door to heaven He once opened with His resurrection? More of the same! YES that's what we need and that's what we have in the Savior Jesus Christ, who “Is the same yesterday and today and forever.” Hebrews 13:8
subject: Unchanging Savior Anchors New Year
verse_text: “Is the same yesterday and today and forever.”

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 34:20-22

For the Lord protects the bones of the righteous; not one of them is
broken! 
21 Calamity will surely overtake the wicked, and those who hate the
righteous will be punished.

22 But the Lord will redeem those who serve him. No one who takes refuge in
him will be condemned. 

Today's Thoughts:

This was a prophecy about Christ when He was crucified. Even though it was
the Roman custom to 

break the legs of the victim to speed dead, not one of Jesus' bones were
broken. The Psalmist says,

"Those who hate the righteous will be punished." What is meant here is those
who have cause pain 

to the Christian will one day find themselves, forsaken, wretched and alone.
As we should be aware 

"The Lord Has redeemed those who serve Him." The ransom was paid by Christ
on the cross.

What a tremendous promise we have here as chapter 34 comes to an end.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord so often we hear that Christians are being tormented and tortured
around the world, 

I thank You for the promise that one day the unrighteous will pay for their
crimes. As we 

have come to the close of another year I pray that Your Spirit would bless
each person who 

reads these devotions. I pray this in the name of Jesus. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

I will thank the Lord because He is just;

I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High. Ps. 7:17
original_reflection_text: This was a prophecy about Christ when He was crucified. Even though it was the Roman custom to break the legs of the victim to speed dead, not one of Jesus' bones were broken. The Psalmist says, "Those who hate the righteous will be punished. " What is meant here is those who have cause pain to the Christian will one day find themselves, forsaken, wretched and alone. As we should be aware "The Lord Has redeemed those who serve Him. " The ransom was paid by Christ on the cross. What a tremendous promise we have here as chapter 34 comes to an end.
original_verse_text: For the Lord protects the bones of the righteous; not one of them is broken! 21 Calamity will surely overtake the wicked, and those who hate the righteous will be punished. 22 But the Lord will redeem those who serve him. No one who takes refuge in him will be condemned.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that not one of Jesus' bones was broken during His crucifixion, fulfilling Your prophetic word. We praise You, Lord, that though the righteous may suffer, You will ultimately punish those who hate and cause pain to Your children. We are grateful that Christ has redeemed us, paying the ransom for our sins on the cross. May we ever serve You faithfully, secure in the promise of Your eternal redemption. Amen.
reflection: This was a prophecy about Christ when He was crucified. Even though it was the Roman custom to break the legs of the victim to speed dead, not one of Jesus' bones were broken. The Psalmist says, “Those who hate the righteous will be punished. ” What is meant here is those who have cause pain to the Christian will one day find themselves, forsaken, wretched and alone. As we should be aware “The Lord Has redeemed those who serve Him. ” The ransom was paid by Christ on the cross. What a tremendous promise we have here as chapter 34 comes to an end.
subject: Righteous Vindicated, Wicked Punished
verse_text: For the Lord protects the bones of the righteous; not one of them is broken! 21 Calamity will surely overtake the wicked, and those who hate the righteous will be punished. 22 But the Lord will redeem those who serve him. No one who takes refuge in him will be condemned.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 35:1-3

O Lord, oppose those who oppose me. Fight those who fight against me.

2 Put on your armor, and take up your shield. Prepare for battle, and come
to my aid.

3 Lift up your spear and javelin against those who pursue me. Let me hear
you say, "I

Will give you victory."

Today's Thoughts:

Cruelty may be far removed from some people's experience, but it is a daily
reality to others.

God promises to help the persecuted and to bring judgment on the unrepentant
sinners.

When our enemies are unjust and lie about us, even when we do good to them,
we can 

appeal to God who is always just. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

I thank You Lord, for Your watchful eyes-and Your ears that are always open

To the cries of Your faithful. Cleanse me from all unrighteousness I pray in
Jesus

Name. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

3 Come, let us tell of the Lord's greatness; let us exalt his name together.


Psalms 34:3
original_reflection_text: Cruelty may be far removed from some people's experience, but it is a daily reality to others. God promises to help the persecuted and to bring judgment on the unrepentant sinners. When our enemies are unjust and lie about us, even when we do good to them, we can appeal to God who is always just. .
original_verse_text: O Lord, oppose those who oppose me. Fight those who fight against me. 2 Put on your armor, and take up your shield. Prepare for battle, and come to my aid. 3 Lift up your spear and javelin against those who pursue me. Let me hear you say, "I Will give you victory."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, the righteous Judge, seeking Your divine intervention. When the wicked prosper and the innocent suffer, we cry out for Your justice and mercy. Lord, strengthen us to overcome the temptation of rejoicing in the downfall of our enemies, for You alone know the hearts of all people. Grant us the wisdom to respond with compassion, even towards those who have wronged us, trusting that You will ultimately bring about true justice. We surrender our battles to You, knowing that You will fight for us and deliver us from the snares of the unrighteous. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Cruelty may be far removed from some people's experience, but it is a daily reality for others. God promises to help the persecuted and to bring judgment on the unrepentant sinners. When our enemies are unjust and lie about us, even when we do good to them, we can appeal to God who is always just.
subject: Trusting God's Righteous Judgment
verse_text: O Lord, oppose those who oppose me. Fight those who fight against me. 2 Put on your armor, and take up your shield. Prepare for battle, and come to my aid. 3 Lift up your spear and javelin against those who pursue me. Let me hear you say, “I Will give you victory.”

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 35:12-13

They repay me evil for good. I am sick with despair

Yet when they were ill, I grieved for them. I denied 

myself by fasting for them, but my prayers returned unanswered. 

Today's Thoughts:

In the previous verses of this chapter David prayed for God's intervention

but he was sad because he thought his prayers were going unanswered.

When our prayers are delayed, it is easy to assume that God has not
answered, 

but remember God hears our every prayer which He answers according to His
wisdom.

Don't let the absence of an immediate answer cause you to doubt or resent
God.

Instead, let it be an occasion to deepen your faith.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, I pray that you would deepen my faith in You so that when You choose


to delay the answers to my prayers I would not become doubtful, but remember


that You are faithful knowing what is best for me. Amen



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right. Phil. 4:8
original_reflection_text: In the previous verses of this chapter David prayed for God's intervention but he was sad because he thought his prayers were going unanswered. When our prayers are delayed, it is easy to assume that God has not answered, but remember God hears our every prayer which He answers according to His wisdom. Don't let the absence of an immediate answer cause you to doubt or resent God. Instead, let it be an occasion to deepen your faith.
original_verse_text: They repay me evil for good. I am sick with despair Yet when they were ill, I grieved for them. I denied myself by fasting for them, but my prayers returned unanswered.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your guidance and wisdom. As we read the words of the Psalmist and the wisdom found in Proverbs, we are reminded of the importance of steadfast love and faithfulness. Lord, help us not to grow weary in our prayers, but to trust in Your perfect timing and sovereign plan. May our faith be strengthened, even in the midst of unanswered prayers, for we know that You hear our cries and will answer according to Your will. We surrender ourselves to You, Lord, and pray that Your love and truth would be the foundation of our lives. Amen.
reflection: In the previous verses of this chapter, David prayed for God's intervention, but he was sad because he thought his prayers were going unanswered. When our prayers are delayed, it is easy to assume that God has not answered, but remember, God hears our every prayer, which He answers according to His wisdom. Don't let the absence of an immediate answer cause you to doubt or resent God. Instead, let it be an occasion to deepen your faith.
subject: Prayers Answered in God's Time
verse_text: They repay me evil for good. I am sick with despair Yet when they were ill, I grieved for them. I denied myself by fasting for them, but my prayers returned unanswered.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 35:17-18

How long, O Lord, will you look on and do nothing? Rescue me from their
fierce attacks.

Protect my life from these lions!

18 Then I will thank you in front of the great assembly. I will praise you
before all the people. 

Today's Thoughts:

Evil is self-destructive, and it is never beyond God's control. God may use
whatever

instrument He chooses to control or punish us. But when we deserve
punishment or 

correction how can we complain about the kind of "rod" God uses on us? We
don't 

need to thank God for the trials in our life, but we should thank Him for
the lessons

He is trying to teach us. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have much to learn, so I pray for passions to accept
the trials 

as a learning experience. Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

I know the Bible is inspiried because it inspires me.
original_reflection_text: Evil is self-destructive, and it is never beyond God's control. God may use whatever instrument He chooses to control or punish us. But when we deserve punishment or correction how can we complain about the kind of "rod" God uses on us? We don't need to thank God for the trials in our life, but we should thank Him for the lessons He is trying to teach us. .
original_verse_text: How long, O Lord, will you look on and do nothing? Rescue me from their fierce attacks. Protect my life from these lions! 18 Then I will thank you in front of the great assembly. I will praise you before all the people.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that the trials and tribulations we face are often Your means of discipline and instruction. Help us to receive Your correction with grace, knowing that You discipline those You love, as a father the son in whom he delights. Give us the wisdom to see the lessons You seek to impart, that we may grow in faith and holiness. Though the path may be difficult, we trust in Your sovereign control over all things. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Evil is self-destructive, and it is never beyond God's control. God may use whatever instrument He chooses to control or punish us. But when we deserve punishment or correction how can we complain about the kind of “rod” God uses on us? We don't need to thank God for the trials in our life, but we should thank Him for the lessons He is trying to teach us. .
subject: Trusting God's Corrective Instruments
verse_text: How long, O Lord, will you look on and do nothing? Rescue me from their fierce attacks. Protect my life from these lions! 18 Then I will thank you in front of the great assembly. I will praise you before all the people.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 35:21-23

They shout, "Aha! Aha! With our own eyes we saw him do it!" 
22 O Lord, you know all about this. Do not stay silent. Do not abandon me
now, O Lord.

23 Wake up! Rise to my defense! Take up my case, my God and my Lord. 

Today's Thoughts:

Have you ever cried out like David when you have been abused? I guess if we
are 

abused it is human nature to lash out in revenge or to give a detailed
defense of 

our every move. But as Christians we like David should ask God to fight our 

battles for us. He will clear our name in the eyes of those who really
matter.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, forgive me when I feel like I need to do or say something 

that would be better if it were left in Your hands. Give me patience 

when I hear things that irritate me, help me remember that I can 

always put my trust in You. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"All Scripture is God-breathed.so that the man of

God may be thoroughly equipted for every good work."

2 Tim. 3:16-17
original_reflection_text: Have you ever cried out like David when you have been abused? I guess if we are abused it is human nature to lash out in revenge or to give a detailed defense of our every move. But as Christians we like David should ask God to fight our battles for us. He will clear our name in the eyes of those who really matter.
original_verse_text: They shout, "Aha! Aha! With our own eyes we saw him do it!" 22 O Lord, you know all about this. Do not stay silent. Do not abandon me now, O Lord. 23 Wake up! Rise to my defense! Take up my case, my God and my Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your justice and protection. When we face abuse or injustice, help us to resist the temptation to retaliate, and instead, trust in Your perfect timing and righteous judgment. Lord, may we follow the wisdom of Proverbs 20:22, and wait patiently for You to vindicate us, for You alone can clear our name and make all things right. We commit our cause to You, knowing that You will fight our battles and bring forth the truth. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever cried out like David when you have been abused? I guess if we are abused, it is human nature to lash out in revenge or to give a detailed defense of our every move. But as Christians, we, like David, should ask God to fight our battles for us. He will clear our name in the eyes of those who really matter.
subject: Letting God Defend Your Name
verse_text: They shout, “Aha! Aha! With our own eyes we saw him do it!” 22 O Lord, you know all about this. Do not stay silent. Do not abandon me now, O Lord. 23 Wake up! Rise to my defense! Take up my case, my God and my Lord.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 36:1

Sin whispers to the wicked, deep within their hearts. They have no fear of
God at all. 

Today's Thoughts:

Because the wicked have no fear of God, nothing restrains them from sinningThey charge ahead as if nothing will happen to them. But God is just and is 

only delaying their punishment. This knowledge should hold us back from 

sinning. Let the fear of God do its work in you to keep you from sin. 

If you have any gratitude for God's love, don't ignore His justice. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, with all the blessings I have received through out my life,

I cannot be anything but thankful. Thankful for Your love and mercy

Thankful for my family and friends, thankful for the country I live in.

Shower them with Your blessings today I pray in Jesus name.Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Love. comes from a pure heart and a good conscience

and a sincere faith. I Tim. 1:5
original_reflection_text: Because the wicked have no fear of God, nothing restrains them from sinningThey charge ahead as if nothing will happen to them. But God is just and is only delaying their punishment. This knowledge should hold us back from sinning. Let the fear of God do its work in you to keep you from sin. If you have any gratitude for God's love, don't ignore His justice.
original_verse_text: Sin whispers to the wicked, deep within their hearts. They have no fear of God at all.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the truth that the fear of You is the beginning of wisdom. We confess that at times, like the wicked, we have lacked the reverence and awe that should keep us from sinning. Yet, we are grateful for Your steadfast love and mercy, which can turn us away from evil. Lord, may Your justice and righteousness be a constant reminder to us, that we may walk in obedience and honor You in all we do. Amen.
reflection: Because the wicked have no fear of God, nothing restrains them from sinning. They charge ahead as if nothing will happen to them. But God is just and is only delaying their punishment. This knowledge should hold us back from sinning. Let the fear of God do its work in you to keep you from sin. If you have any gratitude for God's love, don't ignore His justice.
subject: Restrain Yourself: the Fear of God
verse_text: Sin whispers to the wicked, deep within their hearts. They have no fear of God at all.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 36:2-4 

The wicked arrogantly hunt down the poor. Let them be caught in the evil
they plan for others.

3 For they brag about their evil desires; they praise the greedy and curse
the Lord. 
4 The wicked are too proud to seek God. They seem to think that God is dead.


Today's Thoughts:

Some people succeed in everything they do, and they brag that no one 

not even God, can keep them down. We may wonder why God allows 

these people to gain great wealth while they despise Him as they do.

Bur why are we upset when the wicked prosper? Are we angry about 

the damage they are doing or just jealous of their success? To answer 

these questions we must gain the right perspective on wickedness and wealth.

The wicked will surely be punished because God hates their evil deeds.

We need to remember wealth is only temporary. It is not necessarily a 

sign of God's approval. Don't let wealth become your obsession.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I beg two favors of You before I die. First, help me to never
tell a lie. Second, 

give me neither poverty nor riches! Give me just enough to satisfy my needs.
. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: Some people succeed in everything they do, and they brag that no one not even God, can keep them down. We may wonder why God allows these people to gain great wealth while they despise Him as they do. Bur why are we upset when the wicked prosper? Are we angry about the damage they are doing or just jealous of their success? To answer these questions we must gain the right perspective on wickedness and wealth. The wicked will surely be punished because God hates their evil deeds. We need to remember wealth is only temporary. It is not necessarily a sign of God's approval. Don't let wealth become your obsession.
original_verse_text: The wicked arrogantly hunt down the poor. Let them be caught in the evil they plan for others. 3 For they brag about their evil desires; they praise the greedy and curse the Lord. 4 The wicked are too proud to seek God. They seem to think that God is dead.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that at times we are tempted to envy the wicked and their fleeting success. Forgive us for our shortsightedness and lack of trust in Your perfect plan. Help us to keep our eyes fixed on the eternal rewards You have promised, rather than the temporary riches of this world. May we find our joy and security in You alone, for You are the source of all true and lasting prosperity. Amen.
reflection: Some people succeed in everything they do, and they brag that no one not even God, can keep them down. We may wonder why God allows these people to gain great wealth while they despise Him as they do. Bur why are we upset when the wicked prosper? Are we angry about the damage they are doing or just jealous of their success? To answer these questions we must gain the right perspective on wickedness and wealth. The wicked will surely be punished because God hates their evil deeds. We need to remember wealth is only temporary. It is not necessarily a sign of God's approval. Don't let wealth become your obsession.
subject: Wealth Versus Wickedness: Gaining Perspective
verse_text: The wicked arrogantly hunt down the poor. Let them be caught in the evil they plan for others. 3 For they brag about their evil desires; they praise the greedy and curse the Lord. 4 The wicked are too proud to seek God. They seem to think that God is dead.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 36:5-8

Your unfailing love, O Lord, is as vast as the heavens; your faithfulness
reaches beyond the clouds

6 Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains, your justice like the
ocean depths. You care for people and animals alike, O Lord.

7 How precious is your unfailing love, O God! All humanity finds shelter in
the shadow of your wings.

8 You feed them from the abundance of your own house, letting them drink
from your river of delights. 

Today's Thoughts:

In contrast to evil people and their wicked plots that end in failure, God
is faithful, righteous, and just.

His love is as vast as the heavens-His faithfulness reaches beyond the
clouds-His righteousness is 

as solid as the mountains-and His judgments are as full of wisdom as the
oceans are with water.

We need not fear evil people because we know God loves us, judges evil, and
will care for us 

throughout eternity. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, I thank You for Your faithfulness, justice and love.

In spite of our fallen condition, You continue to pour out

Your love to all who know You. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Great is the Lord who enjoys helping His servant" Ps. 35:27b
original_reflection_text: In contrast to evil people and their wicked plots that end in failure, God is faithful, righteous, and just. His love is as vast as the heavens-His faithfulness reaches beyond the clouds-His righteousness is as solid as the mountains-and His judgments are as full of wisdom as the oceans are with water. We need not fear evil people because we know God loves us, judges evil, and will care for us throughout eternity. .
original_verse_text: Your unfailing love, O Lord, is as vast as the heavens; your faithfulness reaches beyond the clouds 6 Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains, your justice like the ocean depths. You care for people and animals alike, O Lord. 7 How precious is your unfailing love, O God! All humanity finds shelter in the shadow of your wings. 8 You feed them from the abundance of your own house, letting them drink from your river of delights.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your steadfast love that reaches to the heavens and Your faithfulness that extends to the clouds. Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains, and Your judgments are as deep as the great oceans. We take refuge in Your unfailing love, knowing that You will protect us from the schemes of the wicked and guide us in Your righteous ways. May we ever trust in Your eternal care and find our hope in You alone. Amen.
reflection: In contrast to evil people and their wicked plots that end in failure, God is faithful, righteous, and just. His love is as vast as the heavens—His faithfulness reaches beyond the clouds—His righteousness is as solid as the mountains—and His judgments are as full of wisdom as the oceans are with water. We need not fear evil people because we know God loves us, judges evil, and will care for us throughout eternity.
subject: Faithful, Righteous, and Just God
verse_text: Your unfailing love, O Lord, is as vast as the heavens; your faithfulness reaches beyond the clouds 6 Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains, your justice like the ocean depths. You care for people and animals alike, O Lord. 7 How precious is your unfailing love, O God! All humanity finds shelter in the shadow of your wings. 8 You feed them from the abundance of your own house, letting them drink from your river of delights.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 36:9-10

For You are the fountain of life, the light by which we see. 
10 Pour out Your unfailing love on those who love You; give justice to those
with honest hearts. 

Today's Thoughts: "Fountain of Life" 

Is a vivid image of fresh, cleansing water that gives life to the
spiritually thirsty.

This same picture is used in Jeremiah 2:13, where God is called "Fountain of
living water."

Jesus spoke of Himself as living water that could quench thirst forever and
give eternal life

(John 4:14).

Why then should we deprive our souls? The living Word, Jesus Christ, and
the written

Word the Bible, which can satisfy our hungry and thirsty souls. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord we would not think of depriving our bodies of food and water 

when they hunger and thirst. So I pray that I would always seek the
nourishing 

spiritual food that comes to us through Your Word. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"As for me and my house, we will serve the Lord." (Joshua 24:15)
original_reflection_text: "Fountain of Life" Is a vivid image of fresh, cleansing water that gives life to the spiritually thirsty. This same picture is used in Jeremiah 2:13, where God is called "Fountain of living water."  Jesus spoke of Himself as living water that could quench thirst forever and give eternal life (John 4:14). Why then should we deprive our souls? The living Word, Jesus Christ, and the written Word the Bible, which can satisfy our hungry and thirsty souls.
original_verse_text: For You are the fountain of life, the light by which we see. 10 Pour out Your unfailing love on those who love You; give justice to those with honest hearts.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, thirsty for the living water that only You can provide. Like the Psalmist, we long to drink from the fountain of life, to be refreshed and renewed by Your presence. Lord, may we never turn away from the living Word, Jesus Christ, or the written Word, the Bible, for they alone can satisfy the deepest longings of our souls. Fill us, O God, with Your life-giving Spirit, that we may overflow with streams of living water to a world in need. Amen.
reflection: “Fountain of Life” is a vivid image of fresh, cleansing water that gives life to the spiritually thirsty. This same picture is used in Jeremiah 2:13, where God is called “Fountain of living water.” Jesus spoke of Himself as living water that could quench thirst forever and give eternal life (John 4:14). Why then should we deprive our souls? The living Word, Jesus Christ, and the written Word, the Bible, which can satisfy our hungry and thirsty souls.
subject: Quench Your Spiritual Thirst
verse_text: For You are the fountain of life, the light by which we see. 10 Pour out Your unfailing love on those who love You; give justice to those with honest hearts.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 36:11-12

Don't let the proud trample me or the wicked push me around.

12 Look! Those who do evil have fallen! They are thrown down, 

never to rise again. 

Today's Thoughts:

"The wicked" are people who try to make their own way in the world either 

as a law to themselves (Ps. 31:18) or by relying on false gods (Jer.
13:9-10).

" fallen-thrown down" Success and prosperity of the ungodly are fleeting.

This Psalm ends with the nature and ultimate destiny of wickedness.

God has already overthrown all evil and wickedness through His Son, our
Savior.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, I thank You that You defeated sin through the sacrifice of Your SonAnd that by faith in Him my sins are forgiven. I thank You for this even

though such love is beyond my comprehension. .Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full."

John 10:10
original_reflection_text: "The wicked" are people who try to make their own way in the world either as a law to themselves (Psalm 31:18) or by relying on false gods (Jeremiah 13:9-10). " fallen-thrown down" Success and prosperity of the ungodly are fleeting. This Psalm ends with the nature and ultimate destiny of wickedness. God has already overthrown all evil and wickedness through His Son, our Savior.
original_verse_text: Don't let the proud trample me or the wicked push me around. 12 Look! Those who do evil have fallen! They are thrown down, never to rise again.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the fleeting nature of the wicked and their prosperity. We know that their success is but a passing wind, for You have already overthrown all evil and wickedness through the sacrifice of Your Son, our Savior. Lord, may we not be tempted by the allure of the world, but instead, may we find our strength and security in You alone. Guide us to walk in Your ways, that we may stand firm and not be shaken. We trust in Your eternal power and steadfast love. Amen.
reflection: “The wicked” are people who try to make their own way in the world either as a law to themselves (Psalm 31:18) or by relying on false gods (Jeremiah 13:9-10). “fallen-thrown down.” Success and prosperity of the ungodly are fleeting. This Psalm ends with the nature and ultimate destiny of wickedness. God has already overthrown all evil and wickedness through His Son, our Savior.
subject: Overthrow of the Wicked
verse_text: Don't let the proud trample me or the wicked push me around. 12 Look! Those who do evil have fallen! They are thrown down, never to rise again.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 37:1-3

1 Don't worry about the wicked or envy those who do wrong.

2 For like grass, they soon fade away. Like spring flowers, they soon
wither. 
3 Trust in the Lord and do good. Then you will live safely in the land and
prosper. 

Today's Thoughts:

We should never envy evil people, even though some maybe extremely popular 

or excessively rich. No matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish
like 

grass that withers and dies. Those who follow God live differently from the
wicked, 

and in the end, will have treasures in heaven. What an unbeliever gets on
earth may 

last a life time, but what you get from God lasts forever. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, I thank You, for the fact that You are the same yesterday today and
forever.

I thank You, that the promises You have made are the same from ever-lasting
to ever-lasting. .Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Put on charity, which is the bond of perfectness. Col. 3:14
original_reflection_text: We should never envy evil people, even though some maybe extremely popular or excessively rich. No matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish like grass that withers and dies. Those who follow God live differently from the wicked, and in the end, will have treasures in heaven. What an unbeliever gets on earth may last a life time, but what you get from God lasts forever. .
original_verse_text: 1 Don't worry about the wicked or envy those who do wrong. 2 For like grass, they soon fade away. Like spring flowers, they soon wither. 3 Trust in the Lord and do good. Then you will live safely in the land and prosper.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that true and lasting joy is found in You alone. Help us not to envy the fleeting success of the wicked, for their prosperity will fade like the grass. Instead, grant us the wisdom to fix our eyes on the eternal treasures that await those who trust in You. May our hope and confidence rest in Your unfailing love, for in the end, Your faithful ones will inherit the land. We give thanks for Your steadfast presence and the promise of a future filled with hope. Amen.
reflection: We should never envy evil people, even though some may be extremely popular or excessively rich. No matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish like grass that withers and dies. Those who follow God live differently from the wicked, and in the end, will have treasures in heaven. What an unbeliever gets on earth may last a lifetime, but what you get from God lasts forever.
subject: Lasting Treasures, Not Fading Wealth
verse_text: 1 Don't worry about the wicked or envy those who do wrong. 2 For like grass, they soon fade away. Like spring flowers, they soon wither. 3 Trust in the Lord and do good. Then you will live safely in the land and prosper.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 37:4-5

Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you your heart's desires. 
5 Commit everything you do to the Lord. Trust Him, and He will help you.

Today's Thoughts:

David calls us to "take delight in the Lord, and commit everything we have
and do to Him."

But how do we do this? To delight in someone means to experience great
pleasure and 

joy in his or her presence. This, can only happen when we know this person
well. So to 

delight in the Lord, we must know Him better. Knowledge of God's great love
for us will

indeed give us delight.



"To commit ourselves to the Lord," means entrusting everything-our lives,
families, jobs, 

possessions-to His control and guidance. To commit ourselves to the Lord
means to trust 

in Him, believing that He can care for us better than we can care for
ourselves. We should 

be willing to wait patiently for Him to work out what is best for us. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, Help me to remain faithful to a steady diet of Your Word 

so that I will get to know You as I should. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Labor to keep alive in your breast that little spark of celestial fire,
called Conscience.

(George Washington)
original_reflection_text: David calls us to "take delight in the Lord, and commit everything we have and do to Him. " But how do we do this? To delight in someone means to experience great pleasure and joy in his or her presence. This, can only happen when we know this person well. So to delight in the Lord, we must know Him better. Knowledge of God's great love for us will indeed give us delight. "To commit ourselves to the Lord, " means entrusting everything-our lives, families, jobs, possessions-to His control and guidance. To commit ourselves to the Lord means to trust in Him, believing that He can care for us better than we can care for ourselves. We should be willing to wait patiently for Him to work out what is best for us. .
original_verse_text: Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you your heart's desires. 5 Commit everything you do to the Lord. Trust Him, and He will help you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, seeking to delight in Your presence and commit our ways to Your perfect plan. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts, leaning not on our own understanding, but acknowledging You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths according to Your will. May our joy and confidence be found in You alone, for You are the source of all wisdom and goodness. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: David calls us to “take delight in the Lord, and commit everything we have and do to Him. ” But how do we do this? To delight in someone means to experience great pleasure and joy in his or her presence. This, can only happen when we know this person well. So to delight in the Lord, we must know Him better. Knowledge of God's great love for us will indeed give us delight. “To commit ourselves to the Lord, ” means entrusting everything-our lives, families, jobs, possessions-to His control and guidance. To commit ourselves to the Lord means to trust in Him, believing that He can care for us better than we can care for ourselves. We should be willing to wait patiently for Him to work out what is best for us. .
subject: Delight in the Lord; Commit All
verse_text: Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you your heart's desires. 5 Commit everything you do to the Lord. Trust Him, and He will help you.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 37:8-9

Stop being angry! Turn from your rage! Do not lose your temper- it only
leads to harm.

9 For the wicked will be destroyed, but those who trust in the Lord will
possess the land. 

Today's Thoughts:

Anger, rage, and envy are very destructive emotions.

They actually reveal a lack of faith that God loves us and is in control.

We should not worry, instead, we should trust in God giving ourselves 

to Him for His use and safekeeping. When you dwell on your problems, 

you will become anxious and worry. But if you concentrate on God and 

His goodness, you will find peace. Where have you focused your attention?

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, help me to always focus my attention on You, in Jesus name I pray. .
. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God. (I Cor. 10:31
original_reflection_text: Anger, rage, and envy are very destructive emotions. They actually reveal a lack of faith that God loves us and is in control. We should not worry, instead, we should trust in God giving ourselves to Him for His use and safekeeping. When you dwell on your problems, you will become anxious and worry. But if you concentrate on God and His goodness, you will find peace. Where have you focused your attention?
original_verse_text: Stop being angry! Turn from your rage! Do not lose your temper - it only leads to harm. 9 For the wicked will be destroyed, but those who trust in the Lord will possess the land.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our anger, rage, and envy often reveal a lack of trust in Your perfect love and sovereign plan. Forgive us for worrying and dwelling on our problems instead of resting in Your goodness and guidance. Help us to lean not on our own understanding, but to trust in You with all our hearts, knowing that You will direct our paths according to Your will. May we find peace in surrendering our lives to Your safekeeping. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Anger, rage, and envy are very destructive emotions. They actually reveal a lack of faith that God loves us and is in control. We should not worry; instead, we should trust in God, giving ourselves to Him for His use and safekeeping. When you dwell on your problems, you will become anxious and worry. But if you concentrate on God and His goodness, you will find peace. Where have you focused your attention?
subject: Overcome Destructive Emotions with Faith
verse_text: Stop being angry! Turn from your rage! Do not lose your temper - it only leads to harm. 9 For the wicked will be destroyed, but those who trust in the Lord will possess the land.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 37:10-11

Soon the wicked will disappear. Though you look for them, they will be gone.

11 The lowly will possess the land and will live in peace and prosper.

Today's Thoughts:

Being gentle and lowly hardly seems like the type of character that can deal
with enemies.

God's warfare, however, must be carried out with calm faith, humility before
God, and 

hope in His deliverance-Jesus also promises a sure reward for those with
humble attitudes. (Mt. 5:5) 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me to always approach every situation when a 

gentle attitude. Bridle my tongue when I feel the urge to voice a

less than humble attitude. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Love your neighbor as yourself. Mt. 19:19



How seldom we weigh our neighbor in the same balance we weigh ourselves.

(Thomas a Kempis)
original_reflection_text: Being gentle and lowly hardly seems like the type of character that can deal with enemies. God's warfare, however, must be carried out with calm faith, humility before God, and hope in His deliverance-Jesus also promises a sure reward for those with humble attitudes. (Matthew 5:5)
original_verse_text: Soon the wicked will disappear. Though you look for them, they will be gone. 11 The lowly will possess the land and will live in peace and prosper.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. As Your Word instructs, help us to be gentle and lowly, trusting in Your deliverance rather than our own strength. Grant us the faith to face our enemies with calm assurance, knowing that when our ways please You, You will make even our foes to be at peace with us. May we inherit the land and dwell in it forever, for those who are meek shall inherit the earth. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Being gentle and lowly hardly seems like the type of character that can deal with enemies. God's warfare, however, must be carried out with calm faith, humility before God, and hope in His deliverance. Jesus also promises a sure reward for those with humble attitudes. (Matthew 5:5)
subject: Gentle and Lowly in Spirit
verse_text: Soon the wicked will disappear. Though you look for them, they will be gone. 11 The lowly will possess the land and will live in peace and prosper.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 37:21-22

The wicked borrow and never repay, but the godly are generous givers.

22 Those the Lord blesses will possess the land, but those he curses will
die. 

Today's Thoughts:

You can tell a lot about a person's character by the way he/she handles
money.

The wicked person steals under the guise of borrowing-or charging with no 

intension of paying their bill. The righteous person gives generously to the
needy.

But the wicked person focuses on himself, while the righteous person looks
to the 

welfare of others.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, every year the chasm of our nation and you widens. People continue
to defy 

Your laws, and deny Your name in an endeavor to even remove any remembrance 

of You. We thank You Lord, for giving us the victory through Jesus Christ. .
. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all

Your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.

(Mk. 12:30)
original_reflection_text: You can tell a lot about a person's character by the way he/she handles money. The wicked person steals under the guise of borrowing-or charging with no intention of paying their bill. The righteous person gives generously to the needy. But the wicked person focuses on himself, while the righteous person looks to the welfare of others.
original_verse_text: The wicked borrow and never repay, but the godly are generous givers. 22 Those the Lord blesses will possess the land, but those he curses will die.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, recognizing that the way we handle our resources reveals the condition of our hearts. Help us to be generous and gracious, not selfish or deceitful, as we steward the blessings You have entrusted to us. May we seek to meet the needs of others, rather than hoarding for ourselves. Grant us wisdom to walk in righteousness, that our lives may honor You. Amen.
reflection: You can tell a lot about a person's character by the way they handle money. The wicked person steals under the guise of borrowing—or charging with no intention of paying their bill. The righteous person gives generously to the needy. But the wicked person focuses on themselves, while the righteous person looks to the welfare of others.
subject: Handling Money Reveals Character
verse_text: The wicked borrow and never repay, but the godly are generous givers. 22 Those the Lord blesses will possess the land, but those he curses will die.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 37:16, 17

16 It is better to be godly and have little than to be evil and rich.

17 For the strength of the wicked will be shattered, but the Lord takes care
of the godly. 

Today's Thoughts: 

Our attitudes can color our whole personality. We can-not always choose what
happens 

to us, but we can choose our attitude toward each situation. The secret to a
happy heart 

is filling our mind with thoughts that are true, pure, and lovely, with
thoughts that dwell 

on the good things of life (Phil. 4:8). Maybe its time to look at your
attitude and then 

examine what you allow to enter into your mind and what you choose to dwell
on. 

You may need to make some changes.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, awaken my heart when I need an attitude adjustment-for surely I
need your help.

Be with those who are dealing with health issues-in Jesus name. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

If anyone is ashamed of Me-the Son of Man will be ashamed 

of him when He comes in His Fathers glory with the holy angels.

(Mk. 8:38)
original_reflection_text: Our attitudes can color our whole personality. We cannot always choose what happens to us, but we can choose our attitude toward each situation. The secret to a happy heart is filling our mind with thoughts that are true, pure, and lovely, with thoughts that dwell on the good things of life (Philippians 4:8). Maybe its time to look at your attitude and then examine what you allow to enter into your mind and what you choose to dwell on. You may need to make some changes.
original_verse_text: 16 It is better to be godly and have little than to be evil and rich. 17 For the strength of the wicked will be shattered, but the Lord takes care of the godly.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the wisdom found in Your Word, which reminds us that a righteous life, though it may face trials, is more valuable than the wealth of the wicked (Psalm 37:16-17). Lord, help us to cultivate attitudes of joy, gentleness, and peace, casting our anxieties upon You, that we may experience the guarding of our hearts and minds through Christ Jesus (Philippians 4:4-7). May we dwell on what is true, honorable, and praiseworthy, that our lives may reflect Your goodness. Amen.
reflection: Our attitudes can color our whole personality. We cannot always choose what happens to us, but we can choose our attitude toward each situation. The secret to a happy heart is filling our mind with thoughts that are true, pure, and lovely, with thoughts that dwell on the good things of life (Philippians 4:8). Maybe it's time to look at your attitude and then examine what you allow to enter into your mind and what you choose to dwell on. You may need to make some changes.
subject: Cultivate a Positive Attitude
verse_text: 16 It is better to be godly and have little than to be evil and rich. 17 For the strength of the wicked will be shattered, but the Lord takes care of the godly.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 37:22-24

Those the Lord blesses will possess the land, but those he curses will die. 
23 The Lord directs the steps of the godly. He delights in every detail of
their lives.

24 Though they stumble, they will never fall, for the Lord holds them by the
hand. 

Today's Thoughts:

The person in whom God delights is one who follows God, trusts in Him, and
tries to do His will.

God watches over and makes every step firm that a faithful person takes. If
you would like to have 

God direct your way, then seek His advice before you step out. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I believe that You, who are able to do all things
above all that I ask or think, 

are able and willing by the power of Your Holy Spirit to strengthen me for
this life, as I walk in the 

light of Your love. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"For the Lord is good and His love endures forver;

His faithfulness continues through all generations."

(Ps. 100:5)
original_reflection_text: The person in whom God delights is one who follows God, trusts in Him, and tries to do His will. God watches over and makes every step firm that a faithful person takes. If you would like to have God direct your way, then seek His advice before you step out.
original_verse_text: Those the Lord blesses will possess the land, but those he curses will die. 23 The Lord directs the steps of the godly. He delights in every detail of their lives. 24 Though they stumble, they will never fall, for the Lord holds them by the hand.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to walk in Your ways and trust in Your guidance. Help us to lean not on our own understanding, but to acknowledge You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths. May we delight in following Your will, knowing that You watch over us and make our steps firm. Lead us, Lord, that we may glorify Your name in all we do. Amen.
reflection: The person in whom God delights is one who follows God, trusts in Him, and tries to do His will. God watches over and makes every step firm that a faithful person takes. If you would like to have God direct your way, then seek His advice before you step out.
subject: Delight in Following God's Way
verse_text: Those the Lord blesses will possess the land, but those he curses will die. 23 The Lord directs the steps of the godly. He delights in every detail of their lives. 24 Though they stumble, they will never fall, for the Lord holds them by the hand.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 37:25-27

Once I was young, and now I am old. Yet I have never seen the godly
abandoned or their children begging for bread.

26 The godly always give generous loans to others, and their children are a
blessing. 
27 Turn from evil and do good, and you will live in the land forever. 

Today's Thoughts:

Because there are starving children today, as there were in David's day-what
did David mean by these words?

"The children of the righteous need not go hungry because other believers
should help them in their time of need."

In David's day, Israel obeyed God's laws, which ensured that the poor were
treated fairly and mercifully.

As long as Israel was obedient, there was enough food for everyone.

When Israel forgot God, the rich took care of themselves only, and the poor
suffered.



When we see a Christian brother or sister suffering today, we can respond in
one of three ways.

(1) We can say, as Job's friends did-that the afflicted person brought this
on himself.

(2) We can say, this is a test to help the person develop more patience and
trust in God.

(3) We can help the person in need. David would approve of only the last
option.

Although many governments today have their own programs for helping those in
needthis is no excuse for ignoring the poor and needy within our reach. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord Jesus,, by the gift of Your Holy Spirit, make possible in me a
loving heart

So that I would reach out to the poor and needy-that I may keep your
commandments, 

abiding in Your love. I give thee thanks. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"If ye keep My commandments, Ye shall abide in my love." (Jn. 15:10)
original_reflection_text: Because there are starving children today, as there were in David's day-what did David mean by these words? "The children of the righteous need not go hungry because other believers should help them in their time of need. " In David's day, Israel obeyed God's laws, which ensured that the poor were treated fairly and mercifully. As long as Israel was obedient, there was enough food for everyone. When Israel forgot God, the rich took care of themselves only, and the poor suffered. When we see a Christian brother or sister suffering today, we can respond in one of three ways. (1) We can say, as Job's friends did-that the afflicted person brought this on himself. (2) We can say, this is a test to help the person develop more patience and trust in God. (3) We can help the person in need. David would approve of only the last option. Although many governments today have their own programs for helping those in needthis is no excuse for ignoring the poor and needy within our reach. .
original_verse_text: Once I was young, and now 1 am old. Yet I have never seen the godly abandoned or their children begging for bread. 26 The godly always give generous loans to others, and their children are a blessing. 27 Turn from evil and do good, and you will live in the land forever.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the truth found in Your Word. As David proclaimed, You have been faithful to provide for the righteous, even in times of scarcity. Yet, we recognize that there are still those who suffer from hunger and need among us. Lord, open our eyes to see the opportunities to extend Your compassion and care to our brothers and sisters in Christ who are in distress. May we respond with generosity, not judgment, that Your name may be glorified, and Your kingdom advanced. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Because there are starving children today, as there were in David's day-what did David mean by these words? “The children of the righteous need not go hungry because other believers should help them in their time of need. ” In David's day, Israel obeyed God's laws, which ensured that the poor were treated fairly and mercifully. As long as Israel was obedient, there was enough food for everyone. When Israel forgot God, the rich took care of themselves only, and the poor suffered. When we see a Christian brother or sister suffering today, we can respond in one of three ways. (1) We can say, as Job's friends did-that the afflicted person brought this on himself. (2) We can say, this is a test to help the person develop more patience and trust in God. (3) We can help the person in need. David would approve of only the last option. Although many governments today have their own programs for helping those in needthis is no excuse for ignoring the poor and needy within our reach. .
subject: Helping the Needy in Our Reach
verse_text: Once I was young, and now 1 am old. Yet I have never seen the godly abandoned or their children begging for bread. 26 The godly always give generous loans to others, and their children are a blessing. 27 Turn from evil and do good, and you will live in the land forever.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 38:1

1 O Lord, don't rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your rage! 

Today's Thoughts:

As a child may cry to his father, so David cried to God. David was not
saying,

"Don't punish me," but "Don't punish me while You are angry." What I see 

here is that he was acknowledging that he did deserved to be punished, but
he 

asked that God would temper His discipline with mercy. Like children, we are


free to ask for mercy, but we should not deny that we deserve punishment.

Today's Prayer suggestion:

Dear Lord, like David, I pray that You would temper my discipline with
mercy,

I have sinned and deserve to be disciplined but do it in mercy I pray in
Jesus name. Amen.



Pastor Al and Marcie Sather

"The Lord is good and His love endures forever;

His faithfulness continues through all generations."

(Ps. 100:5)
original_reflection_text: As a child may cry to his father, so David cried to God. David was not saying, "Don't punish me, " but "Don't punish me while You are angry. " What I see here is that he was acknowledging that he did deserved to be punished, but he asked that God would temper His discipline with mercy. Like children, we are free to ask for mercy, but we should not deny that we deserve punishment.
original_verse_text: LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our sinfulness and the discipline we deserve. Yet, like a father who has compassion on his children, we ask that You would temper Your righteous anger with Your steadfast love and mercy. Forgive us, Lord, and help us to walk in Your ways, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: As a child may cry to his father, so David cried to God. David was not saying, “Don't punish me,” but “Don't punish me while you are angry.” What I see here is that he was acknowledging that he did deserve to be punished, but he asked that God would temper His discipline with mercy. Like children, we are free to ask for mercy, but we should not deny that we deserve punishment.
subject: Cry to the Father
verse_text: LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 38:2-4

Your arrows have struck deep, and your blows are crushing me

3 Because of your anger, my whole body is sick; my health is broken because
of my sins

4 My guilt overwhelms me- it is a burden too heavy to bear. 

Today's Thoughts:

David saw his anguish as judgment for his sins-although God does not always
send 

physical illness to punish us for our sins-this verse and others in
Scripture indicate 

that He does in certain circumstances. Our sin can have physical or mental
side effects 

that can cause a great amount of suffering. Sometimes God has to punish His
children 

in order to bring them back to Himself.



When we repent of our sins God promises to forgive us. He will deliver us
from sins 

eternal consequences-but He does not promise to deliver us from all of sin's
earthly

consequences.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our
sins.

(I Jn. 1:9)
original_reflection_text: David saw his anguish as judgment for his sins-although God does not always send physical illness to punish us for our sins-this verse and others in Scripture indicate that He does in certain circumstances. Our sin can have physical or mental side effects that can cause a great amount of suffering. Sometimes God has to punish His children in order to bring them back to Himself. When we repent of our sins God promises to forgive us. He will deliver us from sins eternal consequences-but He does not promise to deliver us from all of sin's earthly consequences.
original_verse_text: Your arrows have struck deep, and your blows are crushing me 3 Because of your anger, my whole body is sick; my health is broken because of my sins 4 My guilt overwhelms me- it is a burden too heavy to bear.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with contrite hearts, acknowledging the weight of our sins and the anguish they have brought upon us. Like David, we recognize that our transgressions are not hidden from You, and that the consequences of our actions can be severe. Yet, we are grateful for Your promise of forgiveness when we repent and turn from our wicked ways. Lord, grant us the wisdom to confess our sins, that we may find restoration and peace in Your loving embrace. Amen.
reflection: David saw his anguish as judgment for his sins—although God does not always send physical illness to punish us for our sins—this verse and others in Scripture indicate that He does in certain circumstances. Our sin can have physical or mental side effects that can cause a great amount of suffering. Sometimes God has to punish His children in order to bring them back to Himself. When we repent of our sins, God promises to forgive us. He will deliver us from sin's eternal consequences—but He does not promise to deliver us from all of sin's earthly consequences.
subject: Repentance Brings Forgiveness, Not Deliverance
verse_text: Your arrows have struck deep, and your blows are crushing me 3 Because of your anger, my whole body is sick; my health is broken because of my sins 4 My guilt overwhelms me- it is a burden too heavy to bear.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 38:12-14

My enemies lay traps to kill me. Those who wish me harm make plans to ruin
me. 

All day long they plan their treachery. 
13 But I am deaf to all their threats. I am silent before them as one who
cannot speak.

14 I choose to hear nothing, and I make no reply. 

Today's Thoughts:

It is extremely difficult to remain silent when others tear us down, 

because we want to protect our reputation. We find it difficult to 

do nothing while they attack something so precious to us. But we 

do not have to lash out in revenge or justify our position, we can 

trust God to protect our reputation. 

Jesus was silent before His accusers (Lk. 23:9, 10).

He left His case in the God's hands (I Pet. 2:21-24).

That is a good place to leave our case too!

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, I thank You, that You are a forgiving God, and that I can come
confessing 

my sins with full confidence that You will forgive them all. And so I lay
them at Your 

feet knowing I have been forgiven. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our
sins.

(I Jn. 1:9)
original_reflection_text: It is extremely difficult to remain silent when others tear us down, because we want to protect our reputation. We find it difficult to do nothing while they attack something so precious to us. But we do not have to lash out in revenge or justify our position, we can trust God to protect our reputation. Jesus was silent before His accusers (Luke 23:9, 10). He left His case in the God's hands (I Peter 2:21-24). That is a good place to leave our case too!
original_verse_text: My enemies lay traps to kill me. Those who wish me harm make plans to ruin me. All day long they plan their treachery. 13 But 1 am deaf to all their threats. I am silent before them as one who cannot speak. 14 I choose to hear nothing, and I make no reply.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the difficulty of remaining silent when others seek to tear us down. Grant us the wisdom and strength to trust in Your perfect justice, as Jesus did before His accusers. Help us to leave our case in Your hands, knowing that You will protect our reputation according to Your will. May we find peace in Your unfailing love. Amen.
reflection: It is extremely difficult to remain silent when others tear us down, because we want to protect our reputation. We find it difficult to do nothing while they attack something so precious to us. But we do not have to lash out in revenge or justify our position; we can trust God to protect our reputation. Jesus was silent before His accusers (Luke 23:9, 10). He left His case in God's hands (1 Peter 2:21-24). That is a good place to leave our case too!
subject: Protect Your Reputation Through Trust
verse_text: My enemies lay traps to kill me. Those who wish me harm make plans to ruin me. All day long they plan their treachery. 13 But 1 am deaf to all their threats. I am silent before them as one who cannot speak. 14 I choose to hear nothing, and I make no reply.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 38:17-18

I am on the verge of collapse, facing constant pain.

8 But I confess my sins; I am deeply sorry for what I have done. 

Today's Thoughts:

Sorrow for our sins can result in a changed behavior. The trouble is 

many people are sorry only for the results of their sins or for being 

caught ("sorrow without repentance").



Just compare Peter's remorse with Judas's bitterness and act of suicide.

Both denied Christ. One repented and was restored to faith and service; 

the other took his own life.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

I Thank You, Lord, that when we bring our sins to You in true repentancewe will be restored-What a wonderful assurance of Your grace and mercy. .
Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

I will be gone a week or more so I will be away from the computer soThere will be no Morning devo's for a week-stay warm-The Lord loves you! ! 



!
original_reflection_text: Sorrow for our sins can result in a changed behavior. The trouble is many people are sorry only for the results of their sins or for being caught ("sorrow without repentance"). Just compare Peter's remorse with Judas's bitterness and act of suicide. Both denied Christ. One repented and was restored to faith and service; the other took his own life.
original_verse_text: I am on the verge of collapse, facing constant pain. 8 But I confess my sins; I am deeply sorry for what I have done.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with heavy hearts, acknowledging the weight of our sins. Like the Psalmist, we feel the burden of our transgressions, and our spirits are troubled. Yet, we know that true repentance leads to Your mercy and restoration. Lord, grant us the courage to confess our sins, that we may find forgiveness and walk in the light of Your love. Transform our sorrow into a renewed commitment to live according to Your will. May our lives be a testament to Your grace. Amen.
reflection: Sorrow for our sins can result in a changed behavior. The trouble is many people are sorry only for the results of their sins or for being caught (“sorrow without repentance”). Just compare Peter's remorse with Judas's bitterness and act of suicide. Both denied Christ. One repented and was restored to faith and service; the other took his own life.
subject: Sorrow That Leads to Repentance
verse_text: I am on the verge of collapse, facing constant pain. 8 But I confess my sins; I am deeply sorry for what I have done.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 38:19-22

19 I have many aggressive enemies; they hate me without reason.

0 They repay me evil for good and oppose me for pursuing good.

21 Do not abandon me, O Lord. Do not stand at a distance, my God.

22 Come quickly to help me, O Lord my savior. 

Today's Thoughts:

People who are morally upright expose and shame those who aren't.

If we live for God the world will often hate us, because we make them 

painfully aware of their immoral way of living. We see a bit of fear in 

David which is not too difficult to understand, because his enemies were 

out to get him. Fear can turn into a dark shadow that will eventually 

envelope us and ultimately imprison us within ourselves. 

But we can conquer fear by using the bright liberating light of the Lord 

who brings salvation. If we want to dispel the darkness of fear, let us 

remember with the psalmist that "the Lord is my light and salvation." (Ps.
27:1)

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, forgive me, for complaining to anyone who will listen, while

I often praise You in private-Help me remember to complain in 

private and praise You publicly. I pray this in Jesus name, Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

[He] loved us and gave Himself for us. (Gal. 2:20)
original_reflection_text: People who are morally upright expose and shame those who aren't. If we live for God the world will often hate us, because we make them painfully aware of their immoral way of living. We see a bit of fear in David which is not too difficult to understand, because his enemies were out to get him. Fear can turn into a dark shadow that will eventually envelope us and ultimately imprison us within ourselves. But we can conquer fear by using the bright liberating light of the Lord who brings salvation. If we want to dispel the darkness of fear, let us remember with the psalmist that "the Lord is my light and salvation. " (Psalm 27:1)
original_verse_text: 19 I have many aggressive enemies; they hate me without reason. 0 They repay me evil for good and oppose me for pursuing good. 21 Do not abandon me, O Lord. Do not stand at a distance, my God. 22 Come quickly to help me, O Lord my savior.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your light and salvation in the midst of the darkness that surrounds us. Like David, we face enemies who seek to shame and expose us, but we cling to the truth that You, Lord, are our light and our salvation. Grant us the courage to stand firm in Your righteousness, even when the world hates us for it. Dispel the shadows of fear with the radiant light of Your presence, that we may walk in the freedom and security of Your salvation. We trust in Your unfailing love and mercy, Lord. Amen.
reflection: People who are morally upright expose and shame those who aren't. If we live for God the world will often hate us, because we make them painfully aware of their immoral way of living. We see a bit of fear in David which is not too difficult to understand, because his enemies were out to get him. Fear can turn into a dark shadow that will eventually envelope us and ultimately imprison us within ourselves. But we can conquer fear by using the bright liberating light of the Lord who brings salvation. If we want to dispel the darkness of fear, let us remember with the psalmist that “the Lord is my light and salvation. ” (Psalm 27:1)
subject: Conquer Fear with God's Light
verse_text: 19 I have many aggressive enemies; they hate me without reason. 0 They repay me evil for good and oppose me for pursuing good. 21 Do not abandon me, O Lord. Do not stand at a distance, my God. 22 Come quickly to help me, O Lord my savior.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 39:1-3

I said to myself, "I will watch what I do and not sin in what I say. 

I will hold my tongue when the ungodly are around me."

2 But as I stood there in silence- not even speaking of good thingsthe turmoil within me grew worse.

3 The more I thought about it, the hotter I got, igniting a fire of words: 

Today's Thoughts:

David resolved to keep his tongue from sin, that is, he decided not to 

complain to other people about God's treatment of him. All though 

David did have a reason to complain. David was the anointed king of 

Israel, but he had to wait many years before taking the throne. Then 

one of his sons tried to kill him and become king instead. When David 

could not keep still any longer, he took his complaints directly to God. 



We may all have complaints about our job, or money, or situation, but 

complaining to others may make them think that God cannot take care 

of us. It may also look as if we blame God for our troubles. Instead, like 

David, we should take our complaints directly to God.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

O Lord, I ask that You would forgive me for complaining about the little
things of 

life when there are so many things I should really be thanking You for, like
my health, 

home, family, friends, the freedom of worship-the freedom of speech-the list
could 

go on and on. For these things I do truly thank You. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Jesus is the same yesturday and today and forever. (Heb. 13:8)
original_reflection_text: David resolved to keep his tongue from sin, that is, he decided not to complain to other people about God's treatment of him. All though David did have a reason to complain. David was the anointed king of Israel, but he had to wait many years before taking the throne. Then one of his sons tried to kill him and become king instead. When David could not keep still any longer, he took his complaints directly to God. We may all have complaints about our job, or money, or situation, but complaining to others may make them think that God cannot take care of us. It may also look as if we blame God for our troubles. Instead, like David, we should take our complaints directly to God.
original_verse_text: I said to myself, "I will watch what I do and not sin in what I say. I will hold my tongue when the ungodly are around me. " 2 But as I stood there in silence - not even speaking of good thingsthe turmoil within me grew worse. 3 The more I thought about it, the hotter I got, igniting a fire of words.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts that sometimes struggle to remain silent in the face of life's difficulties. Like David, we may have reasons to complain, but we know that bringing our concerns directly to You is the wisest path. Lord, help us to trust in You as our rock, our salvation, and our fortress, as Your Word instructs. May we find our rest and hope in You alone, pouring out our hearts to You in times of trouble. We surrender our complaints to You, for You are mighty to save. Amen.
reflection: David resolved to keep his tongue from sin, that is, he decided not to complain to other people about God's treatment of him. All though David did have a reason to complain. David was the anointed king of Israel, but he had to wait many years before taking the throne. Then one of his sons tried to kill him and become king instead. When David could not keep still any longer, he took his complaints directly to God. We may all have complaints about our job, or money, or situation, but complaining to others may make them think that God cannot take care of us. It may also look as if we blame God for our troubles. Instead, like David, we should take our complaints directly to God.
subject: Resolve to Keep Tongue from Sin
verse_text: I said to myself, “I will watch what I do and not sin in what I say. I will hold my tongue when the ungodly are around me. ” 2 But as I stood there in silence - not even speaking of good thingsthe turmoil within me grew worse. 3 The more I thought about it, the hotter I got, igniting a fire of words.
